briefdescription.para: This function will set the initial Lin schedule table It's called from the LinTask.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - index of LIN bus

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_Init

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to initialize the Lin schedule table based on the provided index.

briefdescription.para: This function will set a specific Lin schedule table for a provided interface It's called from the LinTask.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the schedule table is provided
- schedule table to be set

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_SetInitialActivatedTable

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to set a provided activated table for a LIN interface

briefdescription.para: This function updates current LIN schedule table and changes it if needed.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - LIN interface to be handled

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_Update

xrefdescription.para: SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_250 SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_247 Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to update the current LIN schedule table.

briefdescription.para: This function will request the flash schedule table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the schedule table is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestFlash

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to request the flash schedule table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will release the flash schedule table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the schedule table is released

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_ReleaseFlash

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to release the flash schedule table for a provided LIN interface

briefdescription.para: This function will check if the flashing table is requested for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: The function will return TRUE after the request LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestFlash(ifc) and FALSE after the request to LinInt_ScheduleTable_ReleaseFlash(ifc).

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - only reads memory multicore safe: Yes - only reads memory synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the check is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsFlashRequested

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if the flashing table is requested for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will check if the flashing table is activated for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: This function will return TRUE only when the actual schedule table is a flashing table. Switch will be done after the current schedule table finishes the current execution.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the check is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsFlashActivated

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if the flashing table is activated for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will check if the flashing table is supported for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - output based only on constants and parameters multicore safe: Yes - output based only on constants and parameters synchronous
This function will return TRUE when flashing table is supported and FALSE when flashing table is not supported.

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the check is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsFlashSupported.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if the flashing table is supported for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will request the alternative schedule table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: For DWA LIN: DWA sounder is coded and the driver door is locked.
If alternative schedule table is requested it should be released using the LinInt_ScheduleTable_ReleaseAlternative() interface.
reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the schedule table is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestAlternative.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to request the alternative schedule table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will release the alternative schedule table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: For DWA LIN: DWA sounder is coded and the driver door is unlocked.
reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the schedule table is released

simplesect.title: Test Method The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_ReleaseAlternative.
Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to release the alternative schedule table for a provided LIN interface.

simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsAlternativeRequested.

briefdescription.para: This function will check if a diagnose table (request or response) is requested for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: The function will return TRUE if a diag table is requested and FALSE if a diag table is not requested

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the check is requested

simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsDiagRequested.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if a diagnose table (request or response) is requested for a provided LIN interface

briefdescription.para: This function will check if a diagnose table (request or response) is active for for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para:
This function will return TRUE if a diagnose table is active for the LIN interface and FALSE otherwise.
No precondition
No postcondition
reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - only reads memory multicore safe: Yes - only reads memory synchronous
linInterface
- interface for which the check is requested
result - TRUE or FALSE Globals
LinScheduleData[] Input->Output-Correlation
N/A Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_IsDiagActivated.
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if a diagnose table (request or response) is active for a provided LIN interface

briefdescription.para: This function will get the request diagnose table for the LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - - output based only on constants and parameters multicore safe: Yes - output based only on constants and parameters synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the diag table is requested

simplesect.para: l_schedule_handle - for each LIN interface x will return the LinConfig[x].diagRequestSchedule

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_GetDiagRequestTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to get the request diagnose table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will get the response diagnose table for the LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - - output based only on constants and parameters multicore safe: Yes - output based only on constants and parameters synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the diag table response is requested

simplesect.para: l_schedule_handle - for each LIN interface x will return the LinConfig[x].diagResponseSchedule

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_GetDiagResponseTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to get the response diagnose table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will restore the previous requested table for the LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: Used after a temporary switch to another LIN table.

simplesect.para: Should be called after a request to LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable

reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the restore is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestOldTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to restore the previous requested table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will temporary save the current requested table for the LIN interface, so that it can be restored later.

detaileddescription.para: Used before a temporary switch to another LIN table.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Should be called before a request to switch to a LIN diagnose schedule table

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the save is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to temporary save the current requested table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will temporary request another table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: There should be a request to switch to a LIN diagnose schedule table. LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable() was used before to save the current requested table

reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the switch is requested
- Schedule table to be used for switch

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to temporary request another table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will get the requested schedule table for the LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: For DWA LIN the result should be the main table if the Sounder is not armed, alternative table if the Sounder is armed or one of the diagnostics table

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which is requested the table

simplesect.para: l_schedule_handle - for the provided LIN interface x will return the LinConfig[x].requestedSchedule

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_GetRequestedTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to get the requested schedule table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will request the LIN bus sleep for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: For DWA LIN called cyclically every approximate 500ms if the Sounder is armed.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the sleep is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestSleep.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to request the LIN bus sleep for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will clear the sleep request for a LIN interface.

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: Will be called when the sleep mode is activated for this LIN interface
reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the clear is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_ClearSleepRequest.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to clear the request sleep for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will increment the diag counter for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The diag counter is incremented only in case haven't reached the max value defined by LIN_DIAG_SCHED_TIMER_MAX

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the clear is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleDiag_IncrementCounter.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to increment the diag counter for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function informs ErrHdl if it can set DTCs regarding the LIN communication.

detaileddescription.para: Switching to LIN flashing might cause timeouts in data frame reception.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - only reads memory multicore safe: Yes - only reads memory synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the check is requested

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The functions will return: TRUE - if a schedule table for data transmission is active FALSE -if a schedule table for data transmission is not active

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleDiag_CommunicationIsValid.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to inform ErrHdl if it can set DTCs regarding the LIN communication.

briefdescription.para: Declaration file for LinSchedule.

detaileddescription.para: This module handles LIN schedule table switching.
